alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:02PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: Poor air quality will continue today into Sunday with Air Quality Index (AQI) values remaining in the healthy range of 100 to 150 across southeast Wyoming and the Nebraska Panhandle due to drifting wildfire smoke across the region. Sensitive groups with respiratory conditions may experience health effects along with others if outside for long durations. Reduced visibilities could also occur where smoke is more dense. Please limit outdoor exposure this weekend if possible, especially with any pre conditions that could be triggered. Slight improving near surface smoke Sunday but lingering smoke likely into early next week.
